0;essay01.txt;http://www.essayforum.com/writing-feedback-3/essay-should-students-taught-compete-cooperate-6788/;Should students be taught to compete or to cooperate?;"It is always said that competition can effectively promote the development of economy. In order to survive in the competition

column4: the whole society prospers. However
column5: when we discuss the issue of competition or cooperation

column4: how to get along with others. During the process of cooperation

column6: how to communicate with others

column2: the significance of competition is that how to become more excellence to gain the victory. Hence it is always said that competition makes the society more effective. However
column3: when we consider about the question that how to win the game
column4: we always find that we need the cooperation. The greater our goal is
column5: the more competition we need. Take Olympic games which is a form of competition for instance
column6: it is hard to imagine how an athlete could win the game without the training of his or her coach
column7: and the help of other professional staffs such as the people who take care of his diet
column8: and those who are in charge of the medical care. The winner is the athlete but the success belongs to the whole team. Therefore without the cooperation
column9: there would be no victory of competition.

column2: no matter from the view of individual development or the relationship between competition and cooperation we can receive the same conclusion that a more cooperative attitudes towards life is more profitable in one's success.";"The debate over whether students should be taught to compete or to cooperate has been ongoing for many years. On one hand
column3: competition can be a powerful motivator and can help students to strive for excellence. On the other hand
column4: cooperation can foster a sense of community and help students to develop important social skills. Ultimately
column5: the answer to this question depends on the individual student and the context in which they are learning.

column1: Competition can be a powerful motivator for students. It can help them to strive for excellence and push themselves to achieve their goals. Competition can also help to create a sense of accountability and responsibility
column2: as students are held accountable for their own performance. Furthermore
column3: competition can help to foster a sense of pride and accomplishment when students are successful.

column2: cooperation can be beneficial for students as well. It can help to foster a sense of community and collaboration among students
column3: which can be beneficial for their social and emotional development. Cooperation can also help to promote problem-solving skills
column4: as students must work together to come up with solutions to challenges. Furthermore
column5: cooperation can help to foster a sense of empathy and understanding
column6: as students learn to work together and appreciate different perspectives.

column2: the answer to this question depends on the individual student and the context in which they are learning. For some students
column3: competition may be the best way to motivate them and help them to reach their goals. For other students
column4: cooperation may be the best way to foster a sense of community and collaboration. It is important for educators to assess the individual needs of their students and create an environment that is conducive to both competition and cooperation.

column2: both competition and cooperation can be beneficial for students. It is important for educators to assess the individual needs of their students and create an environment that is conducive to both competition and cooperation. By doing so
column3: students can benefit from the positive aspects of both competition and cooperation and reach their full potential.";"It is important to consider both sides of the argument when discussing whether or not students should be taught to compete or cooperate. On the one hand
column4: competition can be a powerful motivating force in students. A competitive atmosphere can push students to go beyond what they previously thought was possible and strive for excellence. It is also important to consider the long-term benefits of teaching students to be competitive
column5: as this can give them an edge in the job market after graduation.

column2: an environment where competition is so heavily emphasized can make students less likely to collaborate and share ideas. This can lead to a destructive every man for himself mentality that is not conducive to a productive learning environment. Furthermore
column3: a focus on competition can create an atmosphere of anxiety and stress that can be detrimental to students mental health. Instead
column4: teaching students to work together and cooperate with one another can foster a sense of community among their peers.

column2: there is not one right answer when it comes to teaching students to either compete or cooperate. The ideal solution is likely a balance of the two. Students should be taught the importance of excelling and pushing themselves to reach their full potential
column3: but also be encouraged to learn from one another and engage in meaningful collaboration. By teaching students to use competition and cooperation in an appropriate manner

column1: 8;essay09.txt;http://www.essayforum.com/undergraduate-essays-2/marijuana-persuasive-essay-41857/;The Truth About Cannabis;"Is marijuana as bad as society makes it out to be? The point is people have benefited from marijuana whether it was for medical or recreational purposes. Cannabis is classified as a schedule one drug

column1: ;The truth about cannabis is that it is a complex and controversial topic. It has been used for centuries for medicinal and recreational purposes

column4: which can lead to altered states of consciousness and changes in behavior.

column3: including pain relief
column4: relaxation
column5: and euphoria. It can also cause anxiety
column6: paranoia
column7: and other mental health issues.

column1: Cannabis has been used for medicinal purposes for centuries. It has been used to treat a variety of conditions

column3: nausea
column4: and seizures. It has also been used to help with anxiety
column5: depression

the truth about cannabis is that it is a complex and controversial topic. It has been used for centuries for medicinal and recreational purposes

column1: 9;essay10.txt;http://www.essayforum.com/writing-feedback-3/persuasive-essay-same-sex-marriage-non-issue-essay-39280/;The Non-Issue of Same Sex Marriage;"There is not a single piece of history that determines whether or not same sex marriage is right or wrong. There is absolutely no legal

column2: treated equally
column3: not like they are inferior
column4: and same sex couples should be allowed their civil rights. One day in the future this will be achieved.";"Same sex marriage has been a controversial topic for many years
column5: but it is not an issue that should be debated. Same sex marriage is a human right that should be granted to all individuals regardless of their sexual orientation.

column3: without any limitation due to race
column4: nationality or religion
column5: have the right to marry and to found a family. This right should be extended to all individuals

column1: The argument against same sex marriage is often based on religious beliefs. However
column2: the right to marry should not be determined by religious beliefs. Marriage is a civil right
column3: not a religious one. The government should not be in the business of deciding who can and cannot marry based on religious beliefs.

column2: same sex marriage is no longer a non-issue because it is no longer a divisive political issue. In the past

column1: ;Financial aid to developing countries has become an increasingly important issue in the global economy. With the world becoming increasingly interconnected

column1: ;Paying more money is often seen as the only way to motivate employees to work harder. While it is true that money is a powerful motivator

The fourth factor is a sense of purpose. Employees who feel that their work has a purpose and that it is making a difference are more likely to be motivated to work hard. This can be achieved by providing employees with meaningful work and a sense of purpose.

column2: the fifth factor is a supportive work environment. Employees who feel supported and valued by their colleagues and supervisors are more likely to be motivated to work hard. This can be achieved by creating a positive work environment and providing employees with the resources and support they need to succeed.

column1: 88;essay89.txt;http://www.essayforum.com/writing-feedback-3/topic-not-everything-learned-contained-books-29921/;Knowledge from experience is more important than that from books;"The differences between knowledge from books and from experience have erupted endless controversy.
